text: Virgichneumon maculicauda is a species belonging to the family Ichneumonidae subfamily Ichneumoninae.BiolibCatalogue of life ==Distribution== This species is mainly found in Belgium, British Isles, Germany, Poland, France, Italy, Russia and Spain.Fauna europaea ==Description== Virgichneumon maculicauda has a black body and yellow-orange legs. On the tip of the abdomen, tergite 5 is stained with white spots (hence the species name maculicauda, meaning with spots on the tail).Key to species ==Bibliography== *Wesmael, C. (1845) Tentamen dispositionis methodicae. Ichneumonum Belgii., Nouveaux Memoires de l'Academie Royale des Sciences, des Lettres et Beaux-Arts de Belgique. 18(1944):1-239. *Perkins, J.F. (1953) Notes on British Ichneumonidae with descriptions of new species (Hym., Ichneumonidae)., Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History), Entomology series. 3:103-176. ==External links== * Fugleognatur.dk ==References== Category:Ichneumonidae Category:Insects described in 1953 Category:Hymenoptera of Europe
title: Virgichneumon maculicauda
